label: 掃部寮
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A lesser office (tsukasa) under the Ministry of the Treasury (Ōkurashō) in charge of the beds, mats, cushions, blinds, screens, rushes, reeds, etc. used in the Imperial Palace (Dairi ). Known also as the Inner Housekeeping Office (Uchi-no-kanimori-no-tsukasa). [大蔵省、内裏、内掃部寮]
